message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with tradeoffs in MISO broadcast communication, which involves information theory and networking concepts. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also discusses power allocation and fairness measures, which are relevant to networked systems and communication protocols, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) another likely category. The paper also introduces a new design approach and fairness measure, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper includes simulation results, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia).
